Thx to good FAQ at http://www.gamedev.ru/code/articles/faq_matrix_quat
pScaling
- Receives the output scaling for the x,y,z axes.
pRotation
- Receives the output rotation as a Euler angles.
pPosition

briefdescription.para: Decompose a trafo matrix into its original components Thx to good FAQ at http://www.gamedev.ru/code/articles/faq_matrix_quat.

parameterdescription.para: - Receives the output scaling for the x,y,z axes.
- Receives the output rotation axis.
- Receives the output rotation angle for pRotationAxis.
- Receives the output position for the x,y,z axes.

briefdescription.para: Decompose a trafo matrix with no scaling into its original components.

parameterdescription.para: Receives the output rotation as a hamilton quaternion

briefdescription.para: Creates a trafo matrix from a set of euler angles.

Rotation angle for the y-axis, in radians
Rotation angle for the z-axis, in radians

briefdescription.para: Invert the matrix.

detaileddescription.para: If the matrix is not invertible all elements are set to qnan. Beware, use (f != f) to check whether a TReal f is qnan.

briefdescription.para: Returns true of the matrix is the identity matrix.

detaileddescription.para: The check is performed against a not so small epsilon.

parameterdescription.para: - index of the row.

briefdescription.para: Transpose the matrix.

memberdef.name: FromToMatrix

briefdescription.para: A function for creating a rotation matrix that rotates a vector called "from" into another vector called "to".

detaileddescription.para: Input : from[3], to[3] which both must be normalized non-zero vectors Output: mtx[3][3] a 3x3 matrix in column-major form Authors: Tomas Mueller, John Hughes "Efficiently Building a Matrix to Rotate One Vector to Another" Journal of Graphics Tools, 4(4):1-4, 1999

Input : from[3], to[3] which both must be normalized non-zero vectors Output: mtx[3][3] a 3x3 matrix in colum-major form Authors: Tomas MÃ¶ller, John Hughes "Efficiently Building a Matrix to Rotate One Vector to Another" Journal of Graphics Tools, 4(4):1-4, 1999

briefdescription.para: Represents a row-major 4x4 matrix, use this for homogeneous coordinates.

detaileddescription.para: There's much confusion about matrix layouts (column vs. row order). This is always a row-major matrix. Not even with the aiProcess_ConvertToLeftHanded flag, which absolutely does not affect matrix order - it just affects the handedness of the coordinate system defined thereby.
